text.base: You step off the pier and into the only hotel in town. The lobby smells of lemon polish and dust. A front desk sits guarded by a woman who looks like she's been waiting for you to leave since before you arrived.

lens.believer: The geometry of the room is wrong. The angles of the corners don't add up to 360. Maude, the receptionist, sits at the center of this web, a spider in a cardigan.
lens.skeptic: Structural integrity is questionable; water damage visible on the ceiling tiles. Maude displays classic defensive body languageâ€”crossed arms, averted gaze. She's hiding something.
lens.haunted: It smells like the waiting room. The one where they told you the news. Maude looks at you with the same pitying, contemptuous eyes as the doctor.

receptionist.description: Name tag: 'MAUDE'. She watches you like you're a mistake in the ledger.

interactions.talk: She doesn't look up. 'No vacancies. Unless you have a reservation from before these dates. And you don't look like you belong in this decade, hon.'

plant.description: Plastic. Reviewing it closely reveals a layer of gray dust that feels like ash.

on_success.text: You flip the book around. The pages are blank. All of them. Except for one entry in 1998, written in your handwriting. 'R. VANCE - INDEFINITE'.

on_fail.text: Maude slams her hand on the book. 'You aren't in there. You aren't anywhere.'
